verses.verse: If there be a controversy<WH7379> between men<WH582>, and they come<WH5066> unto judgment<WH4941>, and the judges judge<WH8199> them<WH6663>; then they shall justify the righteous<WH6662>, and condemn<WH7561> the wicked<WH7563>;

and it shall be<WH7563>, if the wicked man be worthy<WH1121> to be beaten<WH5221>, that the judge<WH8199> shall cause him to lie down<WH5307>, and to be beaten<WH5221> before his face<WH6440>, according<WH1767> to his wickedness<WH7564>, by number<WH4557>.

Forty <WH705> stripes<WH5221> he may give him<WH3254>, he shall not exceed; lest<WH3254>, if he should exceed, and beat<WH5221> him above these with many<WH7227> stripes<WH4347>, then thy brother<WH251> should seem vile unto thee<WH7034>.
Thou shalt not muzzle<WH2629> the ox<WH7794> when he treadeth out the grain<WH1778>.

If brethren<WH251> dwell<WH3427> together<WH3162>, and one<WH259> of them die<WH4191>, and have no son<WH1121>, the wife<WH802> of the dead<WH4191> shall not be married without<WH2351> unto a stranger<WH376>: her husband<WH2993>'s brother shall go in<WH935> unto her<WH3947>, and take her to him to wife<WH802>, and perform the duty of a husband<WH2992>'s brother unto her.

And it shall be<WH1060>, that the first-born that she beareth<WH3205> shall succeed<WH6965> in the name<WH8034> of his brother<WH251> that is dead<WH4191>, that his name<WH8034> be not blotted out<WH4229> of Israel<WH3478>.

And if the man<WH376> like<WH2654> not to take<WH3947> his brother<WH2994>'s wife, then his brother<WH2994>'s wife shall go up<WH5927> to the gate<WH8179> unto the elders<WH2205>, and say<WH559>, My husband<WH2993>'s brother refuseth<WH3985> to raise up<WH6965> unto his brother<WH251> a name<WH8034> in Israel<WH3478>; he will<WH14> not perform the duty of a husband<WH2992>'s brother unto me.
Then the elders<WH2205> of his city<WH5892> shall call<WH7121> him<WH1696>, and speak unto him<WH5975>: and if he stand, and say<WH559>, I like<WH2654> not to take her<WH3947>;

then shall his brother<WH2994>'s wife come<WH5066> unto him in the presence<WH5869> of the elders<WH2205>, and loose<WH2502> his shoe<WH5275> from off his foot<WH7272>, and spit<WH3417> in his face<WH6440>; and she shall answer<WH6030> and say<WH559>, So shall it be done<WH6213> unto the man<WH376> that doth not build up<WH1129> his brother<WH251>'s house<WH1004>.
And his name<WH8034> shall be called<WH7121> in Israel<WH3478>, The house<WH1004> of him that hath his shoe<WH5275> loosed<WH2502>.

When men<WH582> strive<WH5327> together<WH3162> one with another<WH251>, and the wife<WH802> of the one<WH259> draweth near<WH7126> to deliver<WH5337> her husband<WH376> out of the hand<WH3027> of him that smiteth<WH5221> him<WH7971>, and putteth forth her hand<WH3027>, and taketh<WH2388> him by the secrets<WH4016>;
then thou shalt cut off<WH7112> her hand<WH3709>, thine eye<WH5869> shall have no pity<WH2347>.
Thou shalt not have in thy bag<WH3599> diverse weights<WH68>, a great<WH1419> and a small<WH6996>.
Thou shalt not have in thy house<WH1004> diverse measures<WH374>, a great<WH1419> and a small<WH6996>.

A perfect<WH8003> and just<WH6664> weight<WH68> shalt thou have<WH8003>; a perfect and just<WH6664> measure<WH374> shalt thou have<WH3117>: that thy days may be long<WH748> in the land<WH127> which Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth thee<WH5414>.
For all that do<WH6213> such things<WH428>, even all that do<WH6213> unrighteously<WH5766>, are an abomination<WH8441> unto Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.
Remember <WH2142> what Amalek<WH6002> did<WH6213> unto thee by the way<WH1870> as ye came forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>;

how he met<WH7136> thee by the way<WH1870>, and smote the hindmost<WH2179> of thee<WH2826>, all that were feeble behind<WH310> thee<WH5889>, when thou wast faint and weary<WH3023>; and he feared<WH3373> not God<WH430>.

Therefore it shall be<WH3068>, when Jehovah thy God<WH430> hath given thee rest<WH5117> from all thine enemies<WH341> round about<WH5439>, in the land<WH776> which Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee for an inheritance<WH5159> to possess<WH3423> it<WH4229>, that thou shalt blot out the remembrance<WH2143> of Amalek<WH6002> from under heaven<WH8064>; thou shalt not forget<WH7911>.
